childMarkdownRemark.html: This is a list of appearances by Jordan Gass-Poore'.

achievement.title: THE MANY LIVES OF JOE NICKELL – UK’S DAILY MAIL PROFILE
achievement.description: The article by Jordan Gass-Poore covers Joe’s formative years, from when he was eight years old and had turned his room into a crime lab, through his experiences as a magician and private detective, and into the field that has earned him worldwide renown, the scientific investigation of claims of the paranormal.

achievement.title: WordCamp for Publishers Presentation: "A Beginner's Guide to Podcasting on WordPress In 10 Steps"
achievement.content: I was chosen in a nationwide search to present on a full scholarship at WordCamp for Publishers about ways to podcast using WordPress.

achievement.title: Making an Impact in the Community, One WordCamp at a Time
achievement.content: Thank you for presenting "A Beginner's Guide to Podcasting on WordPress". I created this presentation and was selected to attend WordCamp for Publishers 2019 on a full scholarship.
achievement.description: Amongst those able to attend were Emma Carew-Grovum, Emily Roseman, Jordan Gass-Poore' and Beth Davidz, who all delivered exceptional sessions and workshops (check out their slides below!).

achievement.title: Flooding: Climate Change Hazards To Infrastructure & Health, Josh Lippert & Jordan Gass-Pooré - 8/19/22 radio show
Outlier Panel Discussion | Using Our Platforms for Good
‘My Family Didn’t Talk About This’: A Podcaster Explores Her Confederate Roots
CUNY Latino Media Summit: “How to Bring a Community Together to Build a Podcast” Workshop
achievement.content: Local Switchboard NYC was chosen to present a two-hour workshop during CUNY's annual Latino Media Summit on the ways audience members can create a hyperlocal podcast to bring their community together.
achievement.description: Description:This session will provide a comprehensive review of how you can bring a community together to build a podcast and why audio content can be valuable to local communities. Participants will learn how to create a hyperlocal podcast from scratch. We’ll discuss how to: Create a mission statement, begin a series of task force meetings throughout neighborhoods in settings relevant to the discussion, and welcome locals to attend these meetings to come and share their ideas and insights for stories that the podcast should tell about their community.

achievement.title: New podcast explores how climate change threatens NJ’s toxic Superfund sites
New York Archives Conference
achievement.content: I was selected to participate in a lightning talk as executive producer of the second season of the Queens Memory Project's podcast.

achievement.title: International Courant Interview
Bleeding in Public: Menstrual Needs Among the Homeless
achievement.content: My work with NPR was cited in an award-winning Tulane University paper.
achievement.description: As reported on NPR, “no jurisdiction has a tampon-specific tax, as it might an alcohol or tobacco tax, and there is no additional tax imposed on these products” (Gass-Poore').

achievement.description: This session will provide a comprehensive review of how you can bring a community together to build a podcast and why audio content can be valuable to local communities. Participants will learn how to create a hyperlocal podcast from scratch. We’ll discuss how to: Create a mission statement, begin a series of task force meetings throughout neighborhoods in settings relevant to the discussion, and welcome locals to attend these meetings to come and share their ideas and insights for stories that the podcast should tell about their community.

achievement.title: Just Busters Speaker Series 2020
achievement.description: Jordan Gass-Poore is one of the founders of Local Switchboard NYC which helps teach audio production to women. They cover everything from getting stories, vetting interviewees to creating a narrative and putting it in a podcast... all for free.  She's worked with media outlets as journalist and editor for years, so we chat about wearing all the hats, dealing with dudes and the trouble explaining to clients what we do.  Use the contact button to find out how to get involved in NYC and learn when this training is coming to your area:  https://www.localswitchboard.nyc/

achievement.title: The International Courant: COVID-19 Interview
achievement.description: Being interviewed about COVID-19's affects on New York City.

achievement.title: I felt left out': how to cope with loneliness at university
achievement.description: “If I was starting my master’s again, I would make an effort to do a class, like yoga or krav maga, outside of university,” says Jordan Gass-Poore, a student at City, University of London.

All Our Rate Guides
achievement.content: Thank you for helping shape the updated rate guide for AIR, a journalism industry leader.
achievement.description: We’re immensely grateful to everyone who took the time to share their experiences and expectations and help shape these guides. We owe a debt of gratitude to each of these folks for their time, insights and candor. Particular thanks to:  Jeremy Bloom, Maggie Bowman, Roby Byers, Susanna Capelouto, Ibby Caputo, Jax Deluca, Matt Frassica, Jordan Gass-Poore’, David Goodman, Sally Herships, Anne Hoffman, Jeff Lunden, Alison MacAdam, Karen Michel, Rae Mondo, Michael Raphael, Claire Schoen.

achievement.title: WHERE IN THE WORLD ARE OUR CHIPSTERS: NASHVILLE
achievement.description: From left: Summer 2014 Chipsters Elizabeth Hernandez and Jordan Gass-Poore’ with Colleen Wright (Spring 2014). The three journalists were part of the Society of Professional Journalists’ Excellence In Journalism news team that covered SPJ’s national conference in Nashville, Tenn., in September.

achievement.title: MASS COMM WEEK 2021: JORDAN GASS-POORE AS A CNN PODCAST PRODUCER AND FREELANCE JOURNALIST
CRISIS COVERAGE: FORT HOOD
achievement.description: Debbie Hiott (alumna), editor for the Austin American-Statesman; Jackie Stone, social media correspondent for the Austin American-Statesman; Kelsey Bradshaw for the Texas State University Star Newspaper and Jordan Gass-Poore for KTSW radio all discussed and answered questions over covering crises like the Fort Hood shooting that occured November 5, 2013.

achievement.title: Student Organization of the Month: SPJ
achievement.content: Texas State University's SPJ chapter received "Student Organization of the Month" under my leadership as chapter president.

achievement.title: Texas State University Mass Comm Week
City Watch with Jordan Gass-Poore', Lilly Tuttle, David Kilpatrick
CHIPSTERS EMBRACE PROMOTIONS, NEW JOBS
achievement.description: Jordan Gass-Poore’ (Summer 2014) is an intern with the NPR affiliate KUT in Austin, Texas, and two Austin-based independent movies called “Dr. Cheapskate” and “The Honor Farm.” She writes, “I’m also the Web content manager with KTSW 89.9 FM, the Texas State University radio station.”

achievement.content: My work was cited in a Northwestern University law paper.
